title: 14 day / 15 day suspension difference?
body:
My Poro Bros !!! Tis I again, this time with a question in regards to behavior.

I've been seeing on the Behavior Boards that people are saying they are getting punished with 15-day bans instead of a 14-day ban. Is that really a thing? I've even seen a screen shot of it, was that screen shot real? I can't see why people would need to photoshop that.

If it is real, what are the different conditions to trigger a 15-day ban as opposed to a 14-day ban?

replies.body: I'm fairly sure players aren't photoshopping those 15 day ban messages, but it's definitely something we're looking into and trying to figure out why it's been saying something different. I'm not sure what's going wrong there myself, but I've been told the ban lengths haven't actually been affected.

> I'm fairly sure players aren't photoshopping those 15 day ban messages, but it's definitely something we're looking into and trying to figure out why it's been saying something different. I'm not sure what's going wrong there myself, but I've been told the ban lengths haven't actually been affected.

I just got a 15 day suspension aswell, maybe it is due to your Servers storing the time a player was banned in the timezone it is at, the server gives my client that time and the client uses my local timezone? This would result in a more than 14 day difference if my time is behind your servers time?

FIGURED IT OUT!!!! 

So it turns out this is just a simple change on the backend to the messaging. Ban lengths haven't been increased I don't believe, this is just a visual messaging change to provide a better estimation of when the account would be unlocked.
Pretty dang sure lul. I mean, regardless, accounts will be banned until the specified time. The account punishment won't be lifted early whether it says 14 or 15 days XP.
